fields.reasoning: Tested '!'. No validation error was triggered and no error message appeared; WCAG 3.3.3 applies only when an error is present.
The select is disabled, so it is not user-editable and does not trigger validation; no error messaging is expected.

Input 'userexample.com' triggered an error with aria-invalid=true and a visible alert. The message shown—"Wrong or Invalid email address or mobile phone number. Please correct and try again."—is vague and does not specify the issue (e.g., missing '@') or provide a concrete fix, so it is not actionable per WCAG 3.3.3.

Input '1234' triggered an error alert stating the minimum length requirement (e.g., "Passwords must be at least 6 characters." / "Minimum 6 characters required"), which clearly tells the user how to fix the problem (increase the password length).
The confirmation value matched the original password, so no validation error was triggered and no error messaging was expected.
